cho_description:
Painted and gilded cartonnage mummy-mask with a striped lappet-wig; representation of Khepri on top of the head; Hieroglyphic text around the fillet; on the back are three painted panels, the uppermost depicting Sekhmet, Isis, Horus and Osiris, the lower two depicting winged deities.

Height: 51 centimetres Width: 25 centimetres Depth: 37 centimetres

COL: [YCA54913](http://www.britishmuseum.org/research/collection_online/collection_object_details.aspx?partId=1&objectId=125374)

180 photographs, Sony A6000, Photoscan pro by Daniel Pett.

** Work to be done to clean up **
